com.ikanow.aleph2.data_model.utils

Class CrudUtils.SingleQueryComponent<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ikanow.aleph2.data_model.utils.CrudUtils.QueryComponent<T>
      • com.ikanow.aleph2.data_model.utils.CrudUtils.SingleQueryComponent<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the bean type being queried
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CrudUtils.SingleBeanQueryComponent, CrudUtils.SingleJsonQueryComponent
    Enclosing class:
    CrudUtils

    public static class CrudUtils.SingleQueryComponent<T>
extends CrudUtils.QueryComponent<T>
implements Cloneable
    Encapsulates a very simple query - this top level all
    Author:
    acp

      • rangeAbove

        public <U> CrudUtils.SingleQueryComponent<T> rangeAbove(String field,
                                                        U lower_bound,
                                                        boolean exclusive)
        Adds the requirement that the field be greater (or equal, if exclusive is false) than the specified lower bound
        Parameters:
        getter - - the field name (dot notation supported)
        lower_bound - - the lower bound - likely needs to be comparable, but not required by the API since that is up to the DB
        exclusive - - if true, then the bound is _not_ included, if true then it is
        Returns:
        the Query Component helper

        Parameters:

        upper_bound - - the upper bound - likely needs to be comparable, but not required by the API since that is up to the DB
        exclusive - - if true, then the bound is _not_ included, if true then it is
        Returns:
        the Query Component helper

      • rangeIn

                                                     boolean upper_exclusive)
        Adds the requirement that the field be within the two bounds (with exclusive/inclusive ie lower bound not included/included set by the
        Parameters:
        getter - - the field name (dot notation supported)
        lower_bound - - the lower bound - likely needs to be comparable, but not required by the API since that is up to the DB
        lower_exclusive - - if true, then the bound is _not_ included, if true then it is
        upper_bound - - the upper bound - likely needs to be comparable, but not required by the API since that is up to the DB
        upper_exclusive - - if true, then the bound is _not_ included, if true then it is
        Returns:

      • orderBy

        @SafeVarargs
public final CrudUtils.SingleQueryComponent<T> orderBy(scala.Tuple2<String,Integer>... orderList)
        Specifies the order in which objects will be returned (ignored if the query component is used in a multi-query)
        Parameters:
        orderList - a list of 2-tupes, first is the field string, second is +1 for ascending, -1 for descending
        Returns:
        the "multi" query component "helper"
